intro: Donnellsmithia cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a suitable choice for woodland gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in some regions.
